intro: Anarthrosyne gracilis, commonly known as the slender glassy fern, is a rare and delicate species of fern native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, translucent fronds that give it a glassy appearance, hence its common name. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in dense forest undergrowth. Its spores are dispersed through wind, and it reproduces primarily through spore propagation rather than seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
